articles.title: Asian Stocks to Gain After US Data, BOJ in Focus: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Asian stocks climbed to a record and the dollar held its losses as global investors favored non-US assets amid policy unpredictability and geopolitical risks. Precious metals also set new all-time highs.

articles.title: Microsoft investigating outage affecting Microsoft 365, Outlook and other services - CBS News
articles.description: Microsoft services were down for thousands of users, according to tracking service Downdetector.

articles.title: Amazon Expected to Cut Thousands More Corporate Jobs Soon - Business Insider
articles.description: Amazon plans major cuts impacting thousands of corporate employees, following a previous round of job cuts in October.

articles.title: Trump sues JPMorgan, Jamie Dimon over cutting off banking access - The Washington Post
articles.description: President Donald Trump filed suit against JPMorgan Chase and its CEO, Jamie Dimon, saying the bank abruptly closed his accounts.

articles.title: Caroline Ellison Leaves US Custody After 14 Months - Newser
articles.description: Cooperating witness in FTX fraud case had received a 2-year sentence

articles.title: Trump Reverses Course on Plan Allowing Homebuyers to Tap 401(k)s - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: President Donald Trump threw cold water on a policy his administration was developing to allow savers in 401(k) retirement plans to use some of that money for down payments on homes — a proposal that had been a key part of his efforts to address voters’ affor…

articles.title: BitGo Is 2026’s First Big IPO. It May Set the Stage for Anthropic and SpaceX. - Barron's
Elon Musk’s Fortune Hits Record $788 Billion As Tesla Spikes 4% - Forbes
articles.description: Musk is closing in on the $800 billion mark as his net worth sets a new record.

articles.title: Elon Musk Sure Made Lots of Predictions at Davos - WIRED
articles.description: Humanoid robots, space travel, the science of aging—Musk weighed in on all of it at this week’s World Economic Forum. But his predictions rarely work out the way he says they will.

articles.title: Winter Storm Fern update: Delta cancels flights in five states, expands waivers for customers to adjust travel - Delta News Hub
articles.description: Due to expected conditions, flight cancelations are necessary at select airports in North Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Louisiana and Tennessee to ensure the safety of Delta's customers and people.

articles.title: Lululemon Now Asks Leggings Buyers to Wear Skin-Toned Underwear - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Lululemon Athletica Inc.’s “Get Low” leggings, derided for being see-through, are available for sale again online. Shoppers just have to make sure to read the disclaimers first.

articles.title: Tesla launches robotaxi rides in Austin with no human safety driver - TechCrunch
articles.description: Not all of Tesla's fleet in Austin will be fully driverless. Per Tesla's AI lead Ashok Elluswamy, the company will be "starting with a few unsupervised vehicles mixed in with the broader robotaxi fleet with safety monitors, and the ratio will increase over ti…

articles.title: The problem with betting Trump will "always chicken out" - Axios
articles.description: Stocks started the week with their worst single day performance since October.

articles.title: Trump Vows ‘Big Retaliation’ as ‘Sell America’ List Grows - Barron's
Big tech is increasingly promising to pay for spiking power costs. But there’s not much to enforce it - CNN
articles.description: As an electricity crunch drives bills higher around the country, big tech companies building power-hungry data centers are increasingly offering to pay for more of the energy they consume, so everyday people don’t get stuck with the bill. But while these comp…

articles.title: NC ticket wins $209.3 million Powerball jackpot - WRAL
articles.description: A Powerball ticket purchased in Roanoke Rapids won the $209.3 million jackpot drawing Wednesday night.

articles.title: Prices ticked up in November as Americans keep spending, a key inflation measure shows - AP News
articles.description: The Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation gauge ticked up in November in the latest sign that price increases remain stubbornly elevated. Consumer prices rose 2.8% in November from a year earlier, the Commerce Department said Thursday, up from a 2.7% annual p…
